snippet: Nineteen chains reported a 0.8 percent increase in sales at stores open at least a year on average, missing the 1.5 percent gain that analysts forecasted.
abstract: Thomson Reuters reports sales at stores open at least a year at major retail chains rose 0.8 percent in April, compared with April 2011; sales missed the 1.5 percent gain that analysts forecasted. Graphs (M)
lead_paragraph: Sales momentum for retailers slowed in April. The 19 chains tracked by Thomson Reuters reported a thin 0.8 percent increase in sales at stores open at least a year, missing the 1.5 percent gain that analysts were expecting.

headline.main: U.S. Retail Sales Fall Short of Forecasts
